2025-12-18.content:
Memorystore for Valkey supports [organization policy constraints](https://docs.cloud.google.com/memorystore/docs/valkey/about-cmek#org-policy). By using these constraints, you can enforce CMEK
protection for your instances and limit which Cloud Key Management Service (KMS)
keys you can use for this protection. This feature is [Generally Available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Valkey support for organization policy constraints
summary.summary: Memorystore for Valkey now supports organization policy constraints, allowing you to enforce CMEK protection for your instances. You can also limit the specific Cloud KMS keys that can be used for this protection. This feature is now Generally Available.

2025-12-11.content: You can now deploy instances in the [`africa-south1` (Johannesburg)](https://docs.cloud.google.com/memorystore/docs/valkey/locations) region.

summary.title: New region available in Africa
summary.summary: You can now deploy instances in the africa-south1 (Johannesburg) region. This expansion brings new capabilities closer to users in Southern Africa.

summary.title: Valkey Node Health Metric Now Available
summary.summary: The /node/server/healthy metric for Valkey is now Generally Available. This metric provides insights into the health of individual nodes within your Valkey instances.

summary.title: Security Fix Deployed
summary.summary: A security fix has been implemented for CVE-2025-49844.

2025-10-21.content:
You can now use [self-service maintenance](https://docs.cloud.google.com/memorystore/docs/valkey/self-service-maintenance)
to update your instance to a newer version. This feature is [Generally Available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Self-service maintenance for Memorystore instances
summary.summary: You can now use self-service maintenance to update your Memorystore instances to newer versions. This feature is Generally Available.

2025-10-17.content:
You can now [create an instance](https://docs.cloud.google.com/memorystore/docs/valkey/create-instances) in
Memorystore for Valkey, even if a zone of the region where you want the instance
to be created is unavailable. If this occurs, then Memorystore for Valkey creates
the instance in the available zones of the region. This feature is [Generally Available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Memorystore for Valkey instances can now be created in available zones when a preferred zone is unavailable.
summary.summary: Memorystore for Valkey now supports creating instances in available zones within a region, even if the initially selected zone is unavailable. This ensures instance availability and is now Generally Available.

2025-10-10.content:
Memorystore for Valkey now supports maintenance changelogs. Maintenance
changelogs provide information about updates available in new maintenance
versions, such as patches for security vulnerabilities.

For links to current maintenance changelogs for each major version of
Memorystore for Valkey, see [Memorystore for Valkey maintenance changelogs](https://docs.cloud.google.com/memorystore/docs/valkey/maintenance-changelog). This feature is [Generally Available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Memorystore for Valkey maintenance changelogs
summary.summary: You can now view maintenance changelogs for Memorystore for Valkey. This helps you stay informed about updates and security patches.

2025-10-06.content:
For each primary node of a Memorystore for Valkey instance, you can now have up to
five replica nodes. For more information, see [Memorystore for Valkey overview](https://docs.cloud.google.com/memorystore/docs/valkey/product-overview). This feature is [Generally Available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Valkey instances now support more replicas
summary.summary: You can now have up to five replica nodes for each primary node of a Memorystore for Valkey instance. This feature is Generally Available.
